decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| The development permitted is approved in accordance with drawing title number(s):
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Ealing Adopted Development Management DPD (2012) policies 7.4 and 7B; London Plan (2015) policies 7.4 and 7.6; and National Planning Policy Framework (March 2012).

| Noise from any flue extractor and associated equipment shall ensure that the external sound level LAeq emitted from plant, machinery/ equipment will be lower than the lowest existing background sound level LA90 by at least 5dBA when measured outside the window of the nearest noise sensitive or residential premises during daytime and night-time hours, in order to prevent any adverse impact on noise sensitive receivers in the surrounding area. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014 with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity. The fan and associated duct work should be isolated from the building structure and the extract unit should be enclosed in a solid, imperforate acoustic enclosure in accordance with a scheme to be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the occupation.
Reason: In order to protect the residential amenity of the locality in accordance with Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016).

| The A3 (restaurants and cafes) use hereby approved shall not operate outside of the hours of 0700-2300 (midnight) Monday to Sunday (including Bank Holidays), and all customers shall vacate the premises within 20 minutes of service ceasing.

Reason: In order to protect the residential amenity of the locality in accordance with Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016). | The external seating areas associated with the A3 use shall not be used outside the hours of 0700-2100 Monday to Sunday (including Bank Holidays), unless otherwise stated in writing by the Local planning Authority.
Reason: In order to protect the residential amenity of the locality in accordance with Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016).

| There shall be no external provision or performance of amplified music, speech or vocals and no internal amplified music, speech or vocals which is audible at the nearest noise sensitive property unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: In order to protect the residential amenity of the locality in accordance with Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016).

| There shall be no emptying of refuse nor bottles/ cans to external bins or areas at the development outside the hours of 0800 to 2000 on Monday to Saturdays (including Public/Bank Holidays), unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: In order to protect the residential amenity of the locality in accordance with Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016).

| Prior to occupation of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council, of the installation, operation, and maintenance of the odour abatement equipment and extract system, including the height of the extract duct and vertical discharge outlet at least 1m above the eaves of the main building. Approved details shall be implemented prior to the commencement of the use and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by cooking odour, in accordance with Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016).

| Prior to use the extract/ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site and surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration, in accordance with Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016).

| The car parking area hereby approved shall be used for the exclusive use of the restaurant staff and its patrons.  These spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose.  Furthermore, a minimum of two disabled parking spaces shall be provided and clearly marked as such.
REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site in accordance with in accordance with Policy 6.13 Parking of the London Plan (2016).
description: Part change of use of the existing car showroom (use class sui-generis) to restaurant (use class A3) including the addition of a mezzanine level (105sqm); associated external alterations including insertion of doors, windows and a single storey canopy to the rear elevation; the insertion of roof lights;  alterations to rear car parking area
